job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
Parker and Lynch is current seeking a Software Engineer in the Kansas City area to work within the Management Information Systems department and be responsible for carrying out software development projects that aid the goals of the company. This role cooperates within a team providing strong, scalable solutions across every department of a fast-growing and agile company.

 


Responsibilities

  • Develop and design customer-facing and internal applications
  • Design internal APIs and develop custom web services
  • Collaborate with Business Analysts as well as other departments to obtain requirements for projects, execute test plans and supply required functionality.
  • Maintain and migrate legacy software and applications
  • Integrate with third party systems
  • Analyze root causes, debug code, and troubleshoot issues

 

Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or a related field
  • Adept in at least one general purpose programming language: Ruby, Python, PHP, Perl, C#, or C++
  • Experience using version control systems like Git and/or Subversion
  • Knowledgeable with Linux and command-line interfaces like Bash and/or KornShell
  • Experience using SQL

 

Skills

  • Strong troubleshooting and debugging skills
  • Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
  • Highly detail oriented
  • Team player

 

What helps you stand out:

Experience with:

  • CSS3 / HTML5
  • Web Services (SOAP/REST)
  • JavaScript (React/ES6/ES7/jQuery)
  • AJAX
  • OWASP
  • Twelve-Factor Applications

 

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive compensation package
  • 401(k) company match and being 100% vested on your first day
  • Great medical benefits
  • Flexible schedule
  • Locally owned with a fun and friendly atmosphere
  • Recognized as one of the Best Places to Work in 2020 by Glassdoor

 

 

Employment Type

  • Full-time
  • Equal opportunity employer

 

 

If you have a strong desire to impact the success of a local organization please apply today!
